title: Light SaaS-style theme refresh with polished motion, split hero, and icon/image cards

requirements.summary: Switch overall site styling from dark glassmorphism to a light SaaS-style theme with subtle light glass cards, rounded corners, and layered sections.
acceptanceCriteria: The default page renders in a light theme (no forced dark mode on initial load).
Background is off-white/soft gray and readable (not pure white), with subtle depth and soft section separation.
Glass-card surfaces appear as subtle light glassmorphism (low opacity + blur) with soft shadow and rounded corners.
Existing components (TopNav, sections, footer, admin panel) remain functional and visually consistent in the light theme.

file_operations.description: Remove the forced dark mode class on the body so the site defaults to the new light theme; keep metadata intact.
Update base styles and utility classes to support a light SaaS-style palette (off-white background, soft shadows, subtle light glassmorphism) while keeping existing components visually consistent.
Refine GlassCard styling to a subtle light-glass surface (low-opacity fill + blur + soft shadow) and light-theme hover behavior.
Adjust TopNav background/blur/border/shadow styling to match light theme while keeping the existing responsive navigation behavior.
Update AdminPanel button/sheet styling to align with the light theme while preserving the existing authenticated-only visibility behavior.
Update admin submissions card/border/background styles for the light theme while keeping the existing admin guard and read-only listing behavior.
Update login/logout button styling to match light theme while keeping existing Internet Identity logic unchanged.
Ensure the app shell and footer use the light theme surfaces and layered section separation while preserving existing layout and functionality.

requirements.summary: Update global styling tokens and page background treatment (subtle gradients and soft lighting) for a coherent light theme with accessible contrast.
acceptanceCriteria: Global CSS variables and base styles produce a coherent light palette (background, foreground, muted, border, ring).
The page background uses subtle gradients/lighting appropriate for a light SaaS layout (no dark bottom gradient).
All text maintains accessible contrast against the light background.

file_operations.description: Rework :root theme tokens for a light palette (background/foreground/muted/border/ring) and replace the current dark gradient body background with a subtle light gradient/lighting treatment.
Align Tailwind theme extensions (shadows/animations/utilities) with the new light tokens and add any needed lightweight keyframes for reveals/parallax polish.

requirements.summary: Revise Hero to a responsive SaaS split layout with exact headline text, intro copy, animated social icons, and a floating/tilted profile image card.
acceptanceCriteria: Hero section layout is two-column on desktop and stacks cleanly on mobile.
Headline text in Hero matches exactly: “Full-Stack Web & Application Developer”.
Hero includes visible social icons (e.g., GitHub/LinkedIn) with hover animation and accessible labels.
Hero includes a profile image displayed in a rounded card with soft shadow; image/card has a subtle tilt or floating effect.
Hero retains smooth navigation behavior (scrolling to Projects and Contact remains available from the hero area).

file_operations.description: Add the generated light hero background image asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-bg-light.dim_1920x1080.png.
Add the generated light accent orb image asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/accent-orb-light.dim_800x800.png.
Add the generated profile illustration/avatar image asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/profile.dim_900x1100.png.

Implement the new hero split layout: left column with exact headline text, 2–3 line intro, and social icons (with hover animation + accessible labels); right column with a rounded, softly shadowed profile card using frontend/public/assets/generated/profile.dim_900x1100.png and a subtle tilt/floating effect; update hero background usage to frontend/public/assets/generated/hero-bg-light.dim_1920x1080.png and orb to frontend/public/assets/generated/accent-orb-light.dim_800x800.png.
Ensure hero scroll targets remain consistent with nav links and the updated hero CTA buttons (Projects/Contact).

requirements.summary: Add lightweight scroll-reveal, hover polish, and subtle transitions across the page while honoring prefers-reduced-motion.
acceptanceCriteria: As the user scrolls, each section’s primary content animates in with a subtle fade + upward motion (once per session/viewport entry is acceptable).
Buttons/cards exhibit gentle lift/shadow/scale on hover without jank.
When the OS setting prefers-reduced-motion is enabled, scroll/hover/transition animations are disabled or reduced to near-zero.

file_operations.description: Create a small hook that returns whether prefers-reduced-motion is enabled, to gate scroll reveal, parallax, and cursor effects.
Create a lightweight IntersectionObserver-based hook for fade-in + slide-up reveal of section content, respecting prefers-reduced-motion.
Add light-theme-appropriate reveal/hover transition utilities (fade/slide, lift/shadow/scale) and ensure reduced-motion rules minimize these effects.
Apply scroll-reveal to the About section primary content using the new scroll reveal hook.
Apply scroll-reveal to Skills section heading and grid content; ensure hover effects align with the new light theme and reduced-motion behavior.
Apply scroll-reveal to Projects section heading and cards; refine hover animations to be subtle and performant.
Apply scroll-reveal to Contact section primary content while preserving validation/submission behavior and success/error states.

requirements.summary: Add gentle, performant hero parallax for imagery/decorations and disable or reduce it under prefers-reduced-motion.
acceptanceCriteria: At least one hero visual element exhibits subtle parallax movement during scroll.
Parallax effect does not cause layout shifts and remains smooth on mid-range devices.
Parallax is disabled or significantly reduced under prefers-reduced-motion.

file_operations.description: Create a small scroll-based parallax hook for subtle transform-only motion (no layout shifts), gated by prefers-reduced-motion.
Apply subtle parallax to at least one hero visual element (e.g., profile card and/or accent orb) using the parallax hook, transform-only for performance.

requirements.summary: Add subtle cursor-based micro-interactions (spotlight/glow) on key surfaces, with graceful touch fallback and reduced-motion support.
acceptanceCriteria: Cursor micro-interaction is visible but subtle on desktop pointer devices (no large/flashy cursor replacements).
Effect degrades gracefully on touch devices (no broken visuals).
Effect is disabled or reduced under prefers-reduced-motion.

file_operations.description: Create a minimal cursor spotlight/glow overlay component that activates only for fine pointer devices, uses transform/CSS variables for performance, and disables/reduces behavior under prefers-reduced-motion.
Add supporting styles for the cursor spotlight effect (subtle light-theme glow, pointer-events disabled), ensuring it never obstructs readability.
Wire CursorSpotlight into the app shell so the effect applies to key page surfaces without interfering with clicking/scrolling.

requirements.summary: Revise Skills section into an icon card grid with subtle hover glow while preserving the exact listed skills.
acceptanceCriteria: Skills are presented as individual cards (or a clearly card-based grid) with an icon and label per skill.
Cards have a subtle hover glow consistent with the light theme.
All listed skills appear and are readable; no listed skill is omitted.

file_operations.description: Replace the grouped list with an icon-card grid for the required skills only: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, React, Next.js, Node.js, Flask, MySQL, MongoDB, Redis, AWS, Python AI/ML workflows; add subtle light-theme hover glow and keep responsive layout.
Add/adjust light-theme utility classes for the skills icon cards (soft border, subtle hover glow) consistent with the overall theme.

requirements.summary: Revise Projects section into image thumbnail cards with title, short description, hover polish, and preserved GitHub URLs.
acceptanceCriteria: Each project card displays a thumbnail image, project title, and short description.
Project cards have smooth, subtle hover animations (lift/shadow/scale) consistent with the light theme.
Each project includes a “View on GitHub” link pointing to the exact existing URLs already used in the app.

file_operations.description: Add the generated project thumbnail image asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/project-home-price-predictor.dim_1200x800.png.
Add the generated project thumbnail image asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/project-simplenntp.dim_1200x800.png.
Add the generated project thumbnail image asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/project-persevan-ai.dim_1200x800.png.

Update project data to include thumbnail images and render card layout with image, title, and short description; keep existing GitHub URLs exactly and include a clear “View on GitHub” link per project; apply light-theme hover polish.

requirements.summary: Update Contact section styling for the light theme with clean inputs and soft focus effects while preserving validation, submission, states, and social links.
acceptanceCriteria: Contact form fields and buttons are styled for the light theme with soft focus states.
Existing client-side validation, submission behavior, and success/error messaging remain functional.
Social/profile links remain visible and accessible within the contact section.

file_operations.description: Adjust Contact form and info-card styling to light SaaS theme (clean fields, soft focus states, subtle borders/shadows) while keeping validation, submission behavior, success/error alerts, and social/profile links unchanged functionally.
Tune global focus ring and form control styling for a soft light-theme focus effect that remains accessible.

requirements.summary: Add light-theme floating decorative shapes/background accents that create depth and layered sections without obstructing content.
acceptanceCriteria: At least 2 decorative background elements/shapes are visible (e.g., soft blobs, orbs, abstract shapes) with subtle motion or positioning.
Decorations never obstruct text readability and remain subtle on all breakpoints.
Decorations are non-interactive and do not interfere with scrolling/clicking (pointer-events disabled).

file_operations.description: Add the generated decorative shapes image asset at frontend/public/assets/generated/decor-shapes-light.dim_1400x900.png.

Create a non-interactive decorative background component that places at least two subtle accents (e.g., frontend/public/assets/generated/decor-shapes-light.dim_1400x900.png plus orb accents) with pointer-events disabled and responsive positioning.
Wire DecorativeBackground into the app shell behind main content to provide layered section depth without affecting navigation or interactivity.
Ensure hero decorative accents integrate with the global decorative background and remain subtle/readable across breakpoints.

requirements.summary: Maintain responsiveness, performance, and SEO metadata after the redesign without adding heavy dependencies.
acceptanceCriteria: All sections render cleanly on mobile, tablet, and desktop without overflow or broken layouts.
No new heavy dependencies are introduced for animations/parallax/cursor effects; performance remains smooth.
Existing title/meta description remain present (update only if needed to align with the new hero headline), and semantic section structure is preserved.

file_operations.description: Review and keep title/meta description present; update meta description text only if needed to align with the hero headline “Full-Stack Web & Application Developer”, without changing the app’s single-page structure.
Ensure hero split layout stacks cleanly on mobile and avoids overflow; keep smooth scrolling behavior for CTA navigation.
Ensure project cards and thumbnails remain responsive and optimized for fast loading (appropriate sizing, no layout shift).
Ensure the skills icon-card grid is responsive across mobile/tablet/desktop and maintains readable spacing.
Ensure contact form layout remains responsive and accessible across breakpoints with no overflow.
Ensure cursor micro-interactions are lightweight, disabled on touch/coarse pointers, and minimized under prefers-reduced-motion to protect performance.
Ensure scroll-reveal runs once per element (or similarly conservative behavior) and cleans up observers to keep performance smooth.
Ensure parallax uses requestAnimationFrame throttling and transform-only updates, disabled/reduced under prefers-reduced-motion.
